attributes.action: Change the age from 25yrs to 20yrs for Cervical Smear Tests for Women in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The NHS say cervical cancer is rare in women under 20, mainly
because teenagers' bodies are still developing. Nowadays, in
our society, young girls are growing up faster and developing
quicker. As women stop growing at approx 21yrs old, just after
puberty, they are more at risk of health problems, including
cell changes in the cervix. 

In some cases waiting for an invitation for a smear test at 25 could be too late for some girls. It is great that the government have finally realized that girls need help and that vaccines for young teenagers are
brought in, but much more is needed to be done. I have been in
touch with women who have had to have smear tests and
treatments/surgery that are under the age of 25, and I myself,
at the age of 19 and 20, had surgery for cancer cells. 

Even though doctors are sometimes reluctant to do smear tests on
under 25s, I feel it’s important we should have the option to
have the opportunity a smear test at a younger age. And as
girls/women are developing faster in this day and age, the age
should be reduced to at least 20 (or even younger)

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
